intro: Orthocarpus erianthus var. gratiosus, commonly known as the silky orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant has hairy foliage, which gives it its common name, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Orthocarpus erianthus var. gratiosus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting native insect populations.
